intro: Nauclea uncaria, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers followed by distinctive, woody, conical fruits that contain several seeds. Nauclea uncaria is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its botanical features make it an important component of the flora in its native ecosystems.
